summary: The 'Improving Newborns’ Food and Nutrition Testing Safety Act of 2025' amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to enhance the safety of infant and toddler food. Key provisions include mandatory sampling and testing for contaminants (lead, cadmium, mercury, arsenic, etc.), record-keeping requirements, and laboratory accreditation standards. The bill also addresses mandatory recall authority, requires reporting of positive test results for pathogens in infant formula, and mandates environmental monitoring for Cronobacter spp. and Salmonella in powdered infant formula manufacturing. It aims to improve food safety and protect vulnerable populations.
